Definitions: Solid: Central
Trabecular: Formed by inner ends of septa
Papillose: Many small rods
Lamellar: Plate-like, parallel to valley
Branching: Elongated projections
Massive: Mound-shaped/Encrusting
Platy: Flattened with calices on only one side
Plocoid: Short-stalked and isolated, separated by coenosteum
Subplocoid: Sometimes separated by coenosteum, each with its own wall
Cerioid: Juxtaposed and even, with own walls (those of massive corals share common walls)
Meandroid: Arranged in multiple series; adjacent valleys share ridges
Flabelloid: Arranged in single series; adjacent valleys do not share ridges
Flabello-meandroid a.k.a flabellate: Long meanderingrows with common base; walls may be partially fused
Phaceloid: Separated by voided space; those with distinct walls separated by coenosteum
Solitary: Entire coral = one corallite
Dendroid: Branch from each other in dendritic pattern
Thamnasterioid: Confluent septa of adjacent corallites, often twisted or sinuous
Hydnophoroid: Cone-shaped protuberances between corallites
Fasciculate: Cylindrical but not in contact; may be dendroid (irregular branches) or phaceloid
